intro: The year 1987 marked the beginning of the First Intifada, a widespread Palestinian uprising against the Israeli occupation. This period was characterized by mass protests, civil disobedience, and a renewed focus on Palestinian self-determination.

events.title: First Intifada Begins
events.text: A Palestinian uprising against the Israeli occupation began in the Gaza Strip and quickly spread to the West Bank. It was largely characterized by civil disobedience, including strikes, boycotts, and stone-throwing by youth.

events.title: UN Security Council Resolution 605
events.text: The UN Security Council adopted Resolution 605, expressing grave concern over the deteriorating situation in the occupied Palestinian territories and deploring Israeli policies and practices.
